comments.body: I think this should be experimental.

comments.body: Shall we use a class directly? I don't see much value of using an interface here, as it has only one implementation.

comments.body: This allows us more flexibility than a single concrete class. Changing a class to an interface is not a binary compatible change, so using an interface is the right thing to do.

comments.body: Then I suggest we move the impl class to a private package like `org.apache.spark.sql.catalyst`. Also the static method should be moved to the impl class as well, as we only create it inside Spark.

comments.body: The implementation class is package-private. If we were to move it to a different package, we would need to make it public for the `of` factory method, which would increase its visibility, not decrease it.
